These tips are my insights from countless reviews, interviews, and hiring over the years. 

They will not be the same as everyone else's. 

I post these as I want to help give the perspective from a hiring manager's POV.

Who's up for a challenge? ğŸ¥‡ 

If youâ€™re a founder looking to enhance your knowledge and gain invaluable insights into building startups, here are 7 amazing podcasts for you - one for each day of this week! â˜ï¸ 

Day 1: â€œHow I Built Thisâ€ by Guy Raz

Guests include companies like Airbnb and Patagonia who share insights, struggles, and lessons learned from building businesses from the ground up.

Day 2: â€œThe Tim Ferriss Showâ€ by Tim Ferriss

Explores both practical and personal aspects of entrepreneurship, with topics ranging from productivity and creativity to personal development strategies.

Day 3: â€œStartUpâ€ by Alex Blumberg

Shares insights on various aspects of business, including marketing, scaling, and fundraising (based on real-life cases and experiences from entrepreneurs.)

Day 4: â€œThe GaryVee Audio Experienceâ€ by Gary Vaynerchuk

Daily podcasts covering insights into entrepreneurship, marketing, social media, and personal development from industry experts.

Day 5: â€œHBR IdeaCastâ€ by Harvard Business Review

Features interviews with business and thought leaders covering topics such as leadership, strategy, innovation, and organisational behavior.

Day 6: â€œEntrepreneur on Fireâ€ by John Lee Dumas

Provides inspiration and practical advice for founders, featuring interviews with successful entrepreneurs like Tony Robbins and @Seth Godin.

Day 7: â€œThe Indie Hackers Podcastsâ€ by Indie Hackers

Includes interviews with indie hackers who share their experiences transparently. Tune into their â€˜Software Socialâ€™ hosted by SaaS founders.

ğŸ’¡ The combination of personal stories and expert advice in these podcasts offers valuable insights into business scaling and development - helping you uncover new approaches to entrepreneurship.

Have any other recommendations? ğŸ§ 

Drop them in the comments below! ğŸ‘‡ 

#Podcasts #Founders #Growth #Entrepreneurship #Insights #IndustryLeaders

100% des dÃ©Ã§us de ChatGPT ne savent en fait pas lâ€™utiliser.

(+ 7 astuces indispensables dans le post)


1) Cadre

Pars du principe que ChatGPT est un stagiaire qui n'a pas la moindre idÃ©e de ce que tu attends de lui.

â†’ Un max de contexte

------

3) Reset

En dÃ©but de conversation, demande-lui toujours dâ€™ignorer toute instruction qui prÃ©cÃ¨de ton message.

Il arrive que des bribes de prompts cachÃ©es soient prÃ©sentes.

Avec Ã§a, ChatGPT les ignore.

------

4) Questions

Demande-lui de te poser des questions pour mieux saisir tes attentes.

Sâ€™il tâ€™en pose, fais de ton mieux pour y rÃ©pondre.

------

5) Feedbacks

Fais-lui des retours en lui demandant dâ€™affiner sa rÃ©ponse.

â†’ De reformuler sa rÃ©ponse sous forme de liste
â†’ De reformuler sa rÃ©ponse sous forme de tweets
â†’ De reformuler sa rÃ©ponse comme si tu avais 5 ans
â†’ De retravailler la forme, le style ou la longueur du texte
â†’ De reformuler sa rÃ©ponse selon une perspective prÃ©cise
â†’ Dâ€™ajouter des exemples, analogies, donnÃ©es ou arguments.

------

6) Effets cumulÃ©s

Fais durer la conversation.

Plus une discussion sâ€™Ã©tend, plus lâ€™IA peut se nourrir des Ã©changes prÃ©cÃ©dents.

Quelques minutes de conversation supplÃ©mentaires peuvent faire toute la diffÃ©rence.

Prends le temps.

------

7) Data Priming

Avec la fonction Advanced Data Analysis, donne-lui de la data concrÃ¨te sur laquelle baser sa rÃ©ponse.

ChatGPT est armÃ© pour identifier des patterns parfois invisibles Ã  lâ€™oeil.

Profites-en Ã  fond.

Pro tip: fais-lui jouer le rÃ´le dâ€™un Data Analyst avec 10 ans dâ€™expÃ©rience. En plus, Ã§a les Ã©nerve quand on en parle sur LinkedIn ğŸ¤¡

------

Bonus :

8) Custom Instructions

Pour les paramÃ©trer : menu en bas Ã  gauche â†’ "Custom instructions".

Celles que j'utilise (+ bonus) en 1er commentaire â†“

------

Pour rÃ©sumer, nâ€™oublie pas que la vraie rÃ©volution derriÃ¨re ChatGPT nâ€™est pas technologique, mais philosophique.

Lorsqu'on parle de #stratÃ©gie d'entreprise, gÃ©nÃ©ralement on pense aux chiffres, au R.O.I. et Ã  Excel. Mais la stratÃ©gie peut aussi Ãªtre drivÃ©e par autre chose que la finance, le marketing ou l'ingÃ©nierie. Elle peut aussi Ãªtre impulsÃ©e par le #design !

data.text:
Our post on visual hierarchy went viral and we're excited to share what worked ğŸš€

Visual hierarchy is a critical aspect of design, as it can help direct the viewer's attention and communicate the relative importance of each element. When done correctly, visual hierarchy can guide users to perform a desired action and make it easier for them to digest information quickly. Our post highlighted some of the most effective ways to achieve visual hierarchy, including size, color, repetition, and contrast. âœ…

But what made our post truly successful was the strategic use of typography contrast, color, and element placement. These elements led readers through the post exactly as we intended, allowing them to easily understand and engage with the content. 

However, we were surprised to find that some readers had a different flow through the post, highlighting the importance of considering different user experiences when designing for visual hierarchy. ğŸ‘€

If you're looking to improve your designs, understanding visual hierarchy is a must. Learn more about the power of visual hierarchy and how to harness it for your own designs at https://lnkd.in/dzekY3ny 

#VisualHierarchy #Design #UXDesign #UIDesign #DesignThinking #IxDF #InteractionDesign
